website_summaries.verdict: Budget conscious and entry level runners will continue to get a reliable and efficient performance in the Asics Flux 4. The shoe may not have the latest in Asics’ technology, but it does not scrimp on comfort or durability. It is a sturdy daily trainer that has sufficient arch support, security, and midsole resilience that will allow the runner to tack on the miles.
pros: Several users claimed that they were able to stay up on their feet for long hours while wearing the 4th instalment of the Gel Flux
More than a handful of runners use this shoe for gym workouts and while doing household works
The price is considered by many as well worth the shoe’s performance
The large, open mesh provides a very breathable coverage
Asics uses a plush interior for a cozy feel with every run
A few noticed barely discernible signs of wear and tear after considerable mileage
The Asics Gel Flux 4 looks much better than its predecessor, according to some runners
cons: A handful of Flux fans were hoping for more weight reduction
A few runners mentioned that the fit is a bit loose

customer_reviews.title: A litlle small to the size
customer_reviews.text: I have had five pairs of gel-flux shoes, from the original through gel-flux four, with this being my second pair of gel-flux four. Except for this pair, all have fit perfectly according to size. These are a little tight in the fore foot area. I'm hoping they will stretch a little as they break in. The gel flux is the best shoe I've found to counteract the effect of under pronation. Also, as an aside, I've been getting a little over 700 miles on a pair of gel-flux. But the g-f 4s prior to this pair were worn out at 450 miles. The sole on the gf4 is radically different from the prior models.
customer_reviews.author: RW-56

customer_reviews.title: If you have normal feet or narrow feet, keep looking. Wide feet, this is your shoe.
customer_reviews.text: The gel and cushion in these shoes for impact is absolutely amazing. That being said, I wouldn't get this pair again. I have fairly average wide feet and i have to really tie these shoes down to keep my feet from sliding around. Also, I have logged about 25 miles on them so far, and they are impossible to break in. The sole has a toe arch support that just slides around and ultimately numbs your balls of your feet to a point you cant run anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: FITS GREAT & COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: My husband is overseas for a year in a country that does not carry his big shoe size. He said these really fit great and he likes how they look. He was very surprised to get them way ahead of the expected delivery date. He also said they are very comfortable for wearing long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: timeforachange

customer_reviews.title: I've been wearing Asics for well over a decade now ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Asics for well over a decade now. They are well made and I find their fit is consistent so it doesn't matter if I buy them in store or on-line.
customer_reviews.author: old man with a view

customer_reviews.title: Best for those of us with 'bad feet'.
customer_reviews.text: I have very bad feet with plantar fasciitis and a collapsed left ankle. With a taped up ankle, THIS is the only shoe that I can actually run some in. Best shoes for what I have. Very light and durable. Has a lot of insole in them if you have flat feet. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, a bit tight around the toes.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent running shoe. But I think I like my last pair of Asics better. This one doesn't seem to have as much cushioning, but I think it does have adequate cushioning. It's also a bit narrow in the toe region. I've heard that most Asics shoes nowadays suffer from being narrow around the toes.
customer_reviews.author: I Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Look good but narrow
customer_reviews.text: Fit is narrower than I'm used to in other asics. They look great, but I prefer the GT 2000 model.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow...
customer_reviews.text: Asics makes a great shoe however This particular shoe is very narrow.. I normally wear 9D in Asics shoes... It feels like I need to order a 9E...
customer_reviews.author: E. Evers

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for my first pair of running shoe bought online.
customer_reviews.author: Enfieldchpl

customer_reviews.title: Buy them today!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommend!! These shoes are SOOOO comfy to run in, or even just walk around in casually.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Asics running shoes are my favorite. Fit, quality and comfort are always very good.
customer_reviews.author: CAS1923

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, i overpronate. Did get some Pinnacle Max inserts for extra support.
customer_reviews.author: robert d bingham jr

customer_reviews.title: Seemed a little tight
customer_reviews.text: Seemed a little tight near the widest part of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Wayne

customer_reviews.title: My brother Loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my brother, he loves it. just fit as expected. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L.N

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with good cushion
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes with good cushioning sole. I walk more than I run in these shoes and I really like how well they absorb the shock.
customer_reviews.author: DC

product_meta.title: ASICS Men's Gel-Flux 4 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Experience a spring-loaded ride with plush underfoot comfort in our GEL-Flux™ 4 shoe, thanks to our guidance Trusstic system® technology. Breathable mesh underlays provide a sock-like fit, designed to increase air-flow and maintain comfort when conditions heat up.
feature_bullets: Rearfoot and Forefoot GEL Cushioning Systems: Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement in multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.
SpEVA Midsole Material: Improves bounce back characteristics and decreases midsole breakdown.
Guidance Line Midsole Technology: Vertical flex groove decouples the tooling along the line of progression for enhanced gait efficiency.
Guidance Trusstic System Technology: This Trusstic System integrates Guidance Line construction for enhanced gait efficiency while providing midfoot structural integrity.
DuraSponge Outsole: A blown AHAR rubber compound for enhanced cushioning and durability in the forefoot.
